content: In what year did the first iPhone make its debut, revolutionizing the smartphone industry?

The first iPhone was unveiled by Apple Inc. on January 9, 2007, during a special event at the Macworld conference in San Francisco. It was officially released on June 29, 2007. The iPhone, designed by Steve Jobs and his team, introduced a revolutionary touch-screen interface and set new standards for mobile devices, significantly impacting the smartphone industry.
